question: When are the two particles said to be in same phase?
option1: if the phase difference between them is an even multiple of π
option2: if the path difference is an even multiple of (<span class='symbol'>λ / 2)
option3: if the time interval is an even multiple of (T/ 2)
explanation: Two vibrating particle are said to be in same phase, if the phase difference between them is an even multiple of π or path difference is an even multiple of (λ / 2) or time interval is an even multiple of (T/ 2).
